items.title: Pentagon's AUKUS review finds areas to put nuclear submarine pact on 'strongest possible footing'
items.summary: The review has "identified opportunities to put AUKUS on the strongest possible footing", the Pentagon says. But a congressman who has seen the report says it "fully endorses" the pact.

items.title: Compressed air energy storage is coming to Broken Hill, but how does it work?
items.summary: Broken Hill will be the location of Australia's first large-scale compressed air energy storage system. What is it and how does it work?

items.title: Local consortium races to rescue Sanjeev Gupta's Tahmoor mine
items.summary: A local consortium is rushing to put forward a bid for the mothballed Tahmoor coal mine, saying it wants the site reopened quickly to protect hundreds of jobs.

items.title: Live updates: ASX to rise, ChatGPT's owner OpenAI launching in Australia
items.summary: The company that brought AI into household vernacular is launching in Australia today. It comes as other companies like Meta are struggling to make traction in this space. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: South Australian golf course wetland is breeding site for locally extinct tiny native olive perchlet
items.summary: Golf courses around the world feature picturesque water ponds as a challenging hazard for players to avoid, but scientists are diving right in. They say golf club wetlands are an ecological safe haven to repopulate threatened native fish.

items.title: Federal politics live: Social media platforms must 'get their act together' ahead of ban, minister says
items.summary: Mark Butler says social media platforms have five days to "get their act together" amid reports some children are already evading the upcoming social media ban. Follow live.

items.title: Alex Carey channels AFL pedigree for classic Ashes catch despite Marnus Labuschagne's tackle
items.summary: Alex Carey's phenomenal catch late on day one at the Gabba would have been special all on its own, but it was made even more impressive after he had to "out-body" his own teammate.

items.title: Manhunt underway in Adelaide for man in cuffs and hospital gown
items.summary: Police are looking for a man who escaped custody in a medical gown and handcuffs in Adelaide's western suburbs, and are warning the public not to approach him.

items.title: Rheumatic heart disease cases drastically reduced in North West Queensland
items.summary: A lack of access to clean clothes and sheets led to high rates of heart disease in this outback Queensland town. But an Indigenous-led washing initiative is changing health outcomes in the region.

items.title: The cold supermoon will appear in the night sky tonight. Here's how to spot it
items.summary: The final supermoon of the year is set to delight stargazers tonight. Here's how to spot it.

items.title: A blend of Cool Runnings, Eddie the Eagle: The Filipino curling team on the cusp of an Olympic spot
items.summary: The idea of the Philippines curling team reaching the Winter Olympics has a hint of Cool Runnings about it, while one team member, Alan Frei, has more than a suggestion of Eddie the Eagle. But at the heart of this story is a genuine sporting fairytale that is one step away from becoming an Olympic legend.

items.title: Impacts of working from home on mental health tracked in study of 16,000 Australians

items.summary: Thousands more properties have fallen under Queensland's land tax regime, as the state is projected to raise hundreds of millions in extra revenue each year from the charge.

items.summary: The Australian Defence Force's bomb disposal squad responds to about 500 unexploded ordnance incidents a year, with many of the devices washing up on beaches.

items.title: What is shotcrete, the material that caused Sydney's M4 tunnel closure?

items.title: Lawyers to face regulators after AI was used to prepare legal document

items.summary: Brodie Taylor has changed the game of netball by overturning disability preconceptions to become the first person in a wheelchair to attain national netball umpiring accreditation.

items.title: Today in History, December 5: How Prohibition was brought down by gangsters, bootleggers and violence
items.summary: Prohibition was officially repealed on December 5, 1933. But the beginning of its end can be traced back years earlier — to a highly-publicised massacre by firing squad.

items.title: Coalition has 'no confidence' social media ban will work under Labor

items.title: 'Extreme fire danger' forecast across South Australia for Thursday
items.summary: The CFS is warning of high fire risk tomorrow with hot and windy conditions forecast, while the BOM has issued a fire weather warning with 'extreme fire danger' for parts of the state.

items.title: Israeli settler outposts spread among West Bank villages and fuel fear of more attacks during olive harvest
items.summary: Palestinian villagers are living in fear, saying that at any time, armed Israeli settlers could descend on them and cause trouble.

items.title: Ryan Papenhuyzen unsure if he'll ever return to professional sport after Melbourne Storm exit
items.summary: Former Melbourne fullback Ryan Papenhuyzen says his future is a "blank canvas" ahead of a break from professional sport that he admits could end up being permanent.

items.title: What the latest GDP numbers mean for interest rates and the economy
items.summary: Australia's latest economic growth numbers show an economy in generally rude health, but that might result in a rude shock for mortgage borrowers earlier rather than later in 2026.

items.title: Algal bloom inquiry quizzes health chief about respiratory illness concerns
items.summary: South Australia's public health chief says there is a need for more data analysis to determine whether there has been an increase in respiratory illness linked to the state's algal bloom.

items.title: Tasmania's local and state governments to pay $650,000 for Foo Fighters concert in Launceston
items.summary: Tasmania's "biggest concert ever" will take place at Launceston's York Park next month when American rock band Foo Fighters play their only Australian show.

items.title: How to prepare yourself and your child for the social media ban on December 10
items.summary: From December 10, young people will lose access to part of their online world. Here's how to support them.

items.title: Is it better to sleep naked or wear pyjamas in summer?
items.summary: What you wear to bed can affect the quality of your sleep. And if that's nothing at all, there are a few things to consider.

items.title: Why dating your therapist is almost never OK
items.summary: A new code of conduct for for Australian psychologists provides updated guidance that it's almost never OK to date someone who is or has been a client, even if that was years ago.

items.title: Search for missing flight MH370 to resume this month, Malaysia says
items.summary: The search for missing Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370 will resume at the end of December, more than a decade after the Beijing-bound flight disappeared.

items.title: Parents left with PTSD after son's death question post-operative care for people with disabilities
items.summary: The parents of a young man with a neuromuscular disease who died seven days after spinal surgery say they have serious concerns about the post-operative care he was provided at Royal Perth Hospital.

items.title: Michael and Susan Dell donate nearly $10 billion to 'Trump accounts' for children
items.summary: Tech billionaires Michael and Susan Dell have pledged $US6.25 billion ($9.5 billion) to new investment accounts for children, known as "Trump accounts". Here's how the donation will work.

items.title: Government considers offloading retiring Tiger helicopters to Ukraine
items.summary: As the United States attempts to broker a peace deal at the Kremlin in Moscow, it is expected a significant funding boost from Canberra to aid Ukraine's war efforts is imminent.

items.title: Bruce Lehrmann loses appeal against failed rape defamation case as lawyer hints at High Court challenge
items.summary: Bruce Lehrmann has lost his appeal against a Federal Court ruling that found on the balance of probabilities he raped his then-colleague Brittany Higgins in 2019.

items.title: What happened to Lisa Lynn? The untold story of Greg Lynn's first marriage and his wife's sudden death
items.summary: Long before Greg Lynn was convicted of murder in Victoria's High Country, his estranged wife died suddenly at home in Mount Macedon. Now, some of those closest to Lisa Lynn are pushing for the coroner to re-examine her death.

items.title: What led Donald Trump to pardon a foreign leader convicted of helping to flood the US with drugs
items.summary: Donald Trump says his country is at war with "narco-terrorists". But he is releasing the former president of Honduras, who was jailed in the US for overseeing one of the world's worst drug conspiracies.

items.summary: Hugh Jackman sung the crowd-pleaser Sweet Caroline and even climbed onto the top of the bar counter for the performance.

items.title: Crystal Fabergé egg shatters record, fetching $46m at auction
items.summary: The Winter Egg is made from finely carved rock crystal, covered in a delicate snowflake motif wrought in platinum with 4,500 tiny diamonds.

items.title: Hopes remain for return of eagles to relocated nest at Bundaberg Hospital site
items.summary: A wedge-tailed eagle's nest was moved in an operation costing about $100,000 involving a 60-tonne crane, a specialist arborist and a carefully engineered basket.

items.summary: Australia's economy expanded 0.4 per cent in the September quarter, coming in below forecasts. But economists say the detail is stronger than the headline indicates. Look back on how the trading day unfolded.

items.summary: Police offer up a $25,000 reward as they try to determine the cause of a blaze that tore through 160 hectares of land, left two homes uninhabitable and completely destroyed another in Geraldton.

items.summary: A stadium on Hobart's waterfront has gained enough support to pass parliament, after key independents declared they would support the contentious project — as it happened.

items.title: Indonesian diaspora divided over new Global Citizenship visa scheme as new details emerge

items.summary: Backpackers and PALM workers in Victoria and Queensland are looking for new jobs following the shock shutdown of Dicky Bill Australia.

items.summary: The independent body in charge of overseeing NSW Police misconduct allegations will today probe the response to Lindy Lucena's fatal bashing in 2023.

items.title: Australia's longest-running radio show celebrates 80 years of rural storytelling
items.summary: Australia's longest-running radio show is celebrating 80 years on air, and while so much has changed in farming and broadcasting, the core of The Country Hour remains the same.

items.title: Israel wants buffer zone between occupied Golan Heights and Damascus in peace deal with Syria
items.summary: Benjamin Netanyahu demands Syria establish a "demilitarised zone" between the border with the Israeli-annexed Golan Heights and capital Damascus, as part of any possible peace deal with the new Syrian government.

items.summary: Robert Kennedy tends his resignation as WA electoral commissioner, nine months after a state election that was plagued by issues including long wait-times to vote, and polling booths running out of ballot papers.

items.title: Government reveals national AI plan to 'serve' Australians

items.summary: State politicians face a looming debate in parliament's upper house, which will finally decide whether a stadium is built at Hobart's Macquarie Point and whether Tasmania gets an AFL side.

items.summary: Days after acting Northern Territory Ombudsman Bronwyn Haack raised the alarm about "inhumane" conditions in overcrowded police cells, the government says just six inmates remain.

items.summary: A $100 million luxury hotel planned for the Darwin Waterfront has fallen through, after concerns were raised by Larrakia traditional owners over its interference with a sacred site.
